author: anderselowsson
content: Concerning header variables, it would in my mind be a strange design to track state gas but not actually use it. If we are going to track state gas, we could just as well use it to achieve full scaling and target state utilization, instead of relying on guesswork that may see us fail to scale. The only valid reason we opted to not do EIP-8075 was because we did not want to add header variables. So I would at least personally find it weird to add header variables but not having the protocol make use of them to actually achieve some desirable state growth and guarantee L1 scaling.

content: How do other clients handle self transfers in 7708? The spec does not explicitely handle this case. Right now in Besu we create a log for them, but the argument could be made that those are just noise and we should skip them.

author: bridge-bot
content:
<vb271828> imo skipping because "just noise" is a wrong path

there is an infinite number of rules you can come up with for when some operation is provably a no-op, you don't want to start adding them all to the protocol (re @eth1x_bridge_bot: <daniellehrner> How do other clients handle self transfers in 7708? The spec does not explicitely handle this case. Right now in Besu we create a log for them, but the argument could be made that those are just noise and we should skip them.)

author: daniellehrner
content:
I think in this case the complexity would be low. We already have a check for `amount != 0`, to add another one with `to != from`, would not increase complexity a lot. We would keep blocks smaller and help propagate them faster through the network.

But I assume self transfers are rather seldom, so it might not really make a difference and the simpler logic might be preferable.

author: bridge-bot
content: <vb271828> right, and there might be situations where the logs are read by automated tools that expect every valid operation to lead to a send, and someone at some point accidentally screws up and puts the wrong field into a textbox and makes a send-to-self, but you don't want the automated tool to croak on that

author: zsfelfoldi
content: In Geth we also create a log for self-transfers, and IMHO we could just leave it that way. Sure, it's very easy to filter out, but do we want to? A self transfer is still an event, it happened for some reason, might be interesting for someone. It's definitely not going to be a bloat.
